output:
Come over the hills, my bonnie Irish lad, Come over the hills to your darling.
When you choose the rose, love, and I'll make the bond, And I'll be your true love forever.
Red is the rose that in yonder garden grows, Fair is the lily of the valley.
Clear is the water that flows from the boy, But my love is fairer than any.
Passed down by Calamity's green woods that we strayed, And the moon and the stars there were shining.
The moon shone its rays on her locks of golden hair, And she swore she'd be my love forever.
Red is the rose that in yonder garden grows, Fair is the lily of the valley.
Clear is the water that flows from the boy, But my love is fairer than any.
It's not for the party that my sister paid,
It's not for the grief of my mother, It's all for the loss of my bonnie Irish class,
That my heart is breaking forever.
Red is the rose that in yonder garden grows, Fair is the lily of the valley.
Clear is the water that flows from the boy, But my love is fairer than any.
Red is the rose that in yonder garden grows, Fair is the lily of the valley.
Clear is the water that flows from the boy, But my love is fairer than any.
